alert.note: Alert for Grant (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 4:09PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN GRANT AND WESTERN PENDLETON COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM EDT... At 409 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Dry Ridge, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Williamstown, Falmouth, Crittenden, Dry Ridge, Butler, Morgan, Goforth, Stewartsville, Greenwood, Northcutt, Williamstown Lake, Gardnersville, Knoxville, Catawba, Gene Snyder Airport and Sherman. This includes I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 153 and 166. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
